newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Private sector keen on new Surat coal permits.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Private sector keen on new Surat coal permits.

text.p: The Queensland state government had received 19 private sector expressions of interest in developing north Queensland's untapped Surat Basin coal potential, state trade minister Doug Slack said.

"Under the supervision of the Queensland Government, the private sector is prepared to provide vital infrastructure including railway lines, water storage management, coal mines and power generation," Slack said in a statement.
The Queensland Government earlier had invited expressions of interest from local and overseas companies to develop the Surat Basin's estimated 4.1 billion tonnes of steaming coal.
The latest expressions of interest included bids from companies and consortiums in Australia and overseas, Slack said.
Government plans for the Surat Basin and nearby Dawson Valley, west of Toowoomba would trigger the region's progress as Queensland's "new frontier," Slack said.
"Providing the necessary infrastructure will unleash the massive potential of the region as a producer of coal, energy and agriculture," Slack said.
